Class Polygon2D

java.lang.Object
util.math.Polygon2D
public class Polygon2D extends Object
Polygon2D represents a polygon in 2D space defined by a list of points (vertices). Provides methods for geometric properties and checks such as area, perimeter, convexity, and validity.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Polygon2D(double[][] points)
    Constructs a Polygon2D from a 2D array of coordinates.
    Polygon2D(List<Point2D> points)
    Constructs a Polygon2D from a list of Point2D objects.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    double
    area()
    Calculates the area of the polygon using the shoelace formula.
    int
    countVertex()
    Returns the number of vertices in the polygon (excluding the closing point if present).
    List<Point2D>
    getPoints()
    Returns the list of points (vertices) of the polygon.
    boolean
    hasRepeatedPoints()
    Checks if the polygon has any repeated points (excluding the closing point).
    boolean
    isClosed()
    Checks if the polygon is closed (the first and last points are equal).
    boolean
    isConvex()
    Checks if the polygon is convex (all internal angles are less than 180 degrees).
    boolean
    isValid()
    Checks if the polygon is valid (has at least 3 non-null points).
    double
    perimeter()
    Calculates the perimeter of the polygon (sum of edge lengths).

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • Polygon2D

      public Polygon2D(List<Point2D> points)
      Constructs a Polygon2D from a list of Point2D objects.
      Parameters:
      points - the list of points (vertices) defining the polygon

    • Polygon2D

      public Polygon2D(double[][] points)
      Constructs a Polygon2D from a 2D array of coordinates. Each sub-array should have two elements: [x, y].
      Parameters:
      points - a 2D array where each sub-array is a point [x, y]

  • Method Details

    • getPoints

      public List<Point2D> getPoints()
      Returns the list of points (vertices) of the polygon.
      Returns:
      the list of points

    • countVertex

      public int countVertex()
      Returns the number of vertices in the polygon (excluding the closing point if present).
      Returns:
      the number of vertices

    • isValid

      public boolean isValid()
      Checks if the polygon is valid (has at least 3 non-null points).
      Returns:
      true if the polygon is valid, false otherwise

    • isClosed

      public boolean isClosed()
      Checks if the polygon is closed (the first and last points are equal).
      Returns:
      true if the polygon is closed, false otherwise

    • hasRepeatedPoints

      public boolean hasRepeatedPoints()
      Checks if the polygon has any repeated points (excluding the closing point).
      Returns:
      true if there are repeated points, false otherwise

    • perimeter

      public double perimeter()
      Calculates the perimeter of the polygon (sum of edge lengths).
      Returns:
      the perimeter of the polygon, or 0 if invalid

    • area

      public double area()
      Calculates the area of the polygon using the shoelace formula.
      Returns:
      the area of the polygon, or 0 if invalid

    • isConvex

      public boolean isConvex()
      Checks if the polygon is convex (all internal angles are less than 180 degrees).
      Returns:
      true if the polygon is convex, false otherwise
